availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Harper (Bath County, Ky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah "Sally" Gudgell Harper in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1846. Father of James Harper, Walter Harper, Morton Harper, Charles Harper, and Mary Harper. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Bath County in 1860. Sheriff in Bath County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 109B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 11.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville Precinct, p. 49B-50A.
Legislative Document, No. 15: Testimony take in the contested election case of B. D. Lacy against Lander Barber, and ordered to be printed by the House of Representatives, December 20, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: State Printing Office, George D. Prentice, 1865), p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273005, p.367.
Find A Grave, "Daniel Harper (1826-1912)," Memorial #69743119, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69743119 (accessed September 20, 2018).
